title.narrative: CFS:EDUCATION

description.narrative: Department of Education has the strategies and skilled staff to integrate Child Friendly Schools, and Disaster Risk Reduction in a Gender responsive and inclusive National Education System by 2017.,which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, policies and programmes to achieve inclusive universal basic education, holistic ECCD and alternative pathways to learning are in place and effectively implemented by Department of Education and Department of Community Development.

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Department of Education has the strategies and skilled staff to integrate Child Friendly Schools, and Disaster Risk Reduction in a Gender responsive and inclusive National Education System by 2017.

description.narrative: Child Friendly School (CFS) indicators have been integrated in the National Quality School Standards Framework of the National Department of Education for school inspectors. Partnership with FBOs and CBOs has strengthened gender responsive school Learning and Implementation Plans (SLIP) valuing girls education and those of children with disabilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: # of EIE Focal Points trained on Comprehensive School Safety.
# of DoE and PDoE Focal Points successfully trained in gender mainstreaming.
Schools with school development plans that explicitly address equity issues and that were developed with UNICEF support
Number of schools / communities developing and implementing DRR measures/plans with UNICEF support
# of Schools certified as meeting CFS minimum standards (in selected provinces).
a1c. Active involvement of school management committees at primary and secondary levels in the development of school improvement plans and monitoring of schools - score (1-4), see guidance
Schools in a box or replenishment kits funded by UNICEF

e4b. Education Sector Policy/Plan with quality prevention and response mechanisms to address gender based violence in and around schools - score (1-4), see guidance
